title: Waterfalls
text: Throughout Iceland, there are many glaciers; the 3 largest are Vatnajökull, Langjökull, and Hofsjökull, but there are hundreds of other smaller glaciers all over the country, covering about 10% of the land (around 10,400 square kilometers). As a result, there are also waterfalls all over the place! Here are a few that we visited during our trip:

title: Waterfalls
text:
June 20th, 2025
Further downstream is Hraunfossar. Technically, this is a collection of smaller waterfalls formed by rivulets streaming out of the Hallmundarhraun, a lava field which flowed from an eruption of one fo the volcanoes lying under the glacier Langjökull.

title: Animals

title: Iceland 2025
text:
This is a digital scrapbook for our trip to Iceland on June 16th, 2025 to June 26th, 2025.
This website is best viewed on a computer, or in landscape mode on your phone or tablet.
Love Alex & Noah

title: Iceland 2025
text:
Our Favourite Views
















































































No matching items

title: Route
text:
The driving route we took through the country using Alex’s road maps. Maybe a section of scary routes at the end with elevation.




June 17th: Arrived in Reykjavik and walked around




June 18th: Drove to Thingvellir, Geysir, and Gulfoss, then back to Reykjavik




June 19th: Walked around Reykjavik. Tried Opal.




June 20th: Drive to Vidgelmir cave, then to Gil Guesthouse




June 21st: Drove to Rauðisandur and Latrabjarg, then to Harbour Inn Guesthouse in Bíldudalur.




June 22nd: Drove to Dynjandi waterfall and Isafjordur, then to Einarshusid Guesthouse in Bolungarvik.




June 23th: Drove to Holmavik, saw the sheep farming museum then drove to Dala Hotel




June 24th: Drove to Grindavik and the Rekyjanes, then to Northern Lights Inn. Stopped in at the Blue Lagoon.




June 25th: Drove around the Reykjanes again and hiked Fagradalsfjall volcano, then back to Reykjavik




That’s all!














 Back to top
